message.content:
cs.IT, cs.AR, cs.ET, cs.DS, cs.SY. 

This paper is primarily focused on the implementation of a decoding algorithm for polar codes, which are a type of error-correcting code used in information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the VLSI architecture used to implement the algorithm, which falls under the category of computer architecture (cs.AR). Additionally, the paper proposes a double thresholding scheme as a fast approximate-sorting method, which could be considered a type of algorithmic optimization (cs.ET) or data structures (cs.DS). Finally, the paper discusses the applicability of polar codes in high-throughput and latency-sensitive applications, which could be considered a systems perspective (cs.SY).
